description.narrative: Children and youth, especially in the most disadvantaged zobas, have the knowledge and skills to participate in school and community-based activities., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Eritrean girls and boys in four Zobas have access to quality Basic Education and Child Protection Services

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and youth, especially in the most disadvantaged zobas, have the knowledge and skills to participate in school and community-based activities.

description.narrative: Ten core life-skills competencies were mainstreamed in regular life-skills-based health education in 2019, which is conducted weekly for grades 4 to 12 in all Eritrean schools, reaching approximately 389,000 children (46 per cent female). Total of 722 school children (318 girls) in Northern Red Sea region participated in sports competition organized by UNICEF and the National Union of Eritrean Youth and Students to create a youth-friendly school environment. Strengthening the capacity of 134 child/youth representatives (50 per cent girls) of 67 child rights committees contributed to enhancing children's participation, strengthening their resilience and increasing their determination to remain in school. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Skills - National curricula and training support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4)

Service Delivery - Skills - Number of children who have participated in skills development programmes for learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and/or employability through UNICEF-supported programmes
